case_title: MIR HASSAN vs MASTER HAMMAD through his next friend and another
respondant: Master Hammad through his next friend

accussed_details.name: Mir Hassan
allegation: Rash and negligent driving causing a traffic accident

complaint_summary: Respondent No. 1, a minor, filed a suit through his father for recovery of Rs. 5,500,000 as damages due to injuries sustained in a traffic accident caused by rash and negligent driving of the coach driven by the appellant.
investigation_summary: The accident occurred on 19-12-2002 when the coach (registration No. JE-1273) driven by Mir Hassan struck the minor pedestrian, resulting in severe injuries including amputation of the left leg. Medical treatment spanned multiple hospitals and surgeries, leading to permanent disability.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the appeal, holding the appellant liable for negligence. The suit was decreed jointly and severally against the appellant and respondent No. 2 for Rs. 800,000 with 14% per annum interest from the date of decree until realization.
punishment: Payment of Rs. 800,000 with 14% per annum interest jointly and severally by the appellant and respondent No. 2.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued that the accident was unavoidable and not due to negligence.
Respondent argued that the appellant failed to exercise due care while driving a heavy vehicle on a public road.
citations: Federation of Pakistan v. Hafiza Malika Khatoon Begum and others 1996 SCMR 406
Pakistan Steel Mills Corporation Ltd. Karachi and another v. Ehteshamuddin Qureshi 2005 SCMR 1392
Punjab Road Transport Board v. Abdul Wahid Usmani and others PLD 1980 Lahore 584
Amul Ramchandra Gandhi v. Abhasbhai Kasambhai Diwan and others AIR 1979 Gujarat 14

witness_statement.Abdul Hameed: Driver of the coach dashed the minor pedestrian at high speed and dragged him for about a dozen feet, causing severe injuries.

key_issues: Whether the driver was negligent in causing the accident.
Whether the appellant and respondent No. 2 are liable for damages.

maxims.Contributory Negligence: The plea of contributory negligence must be proved by the party alleging it.

words_and_phrases.Rash and negligent driving: Driving in a manner that endangers life or property.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a minor pedestrian injured in a traffic accident caused by rash and negligent driving. The court upheld the liability of the driver and vehicle owner, emphasizing the need for extra care in operating heavy vehicles on public roads.
